Text saved: Suzanne Collins got an important idea for her book, The Hunger Games, from her love of old Greek stories. When she was a child, one of her favourite stories was about Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, the city of Athens was ruled by Crete, but the people of Athens fought against them. As a punishment, Minos, who was the king of Crete, made the Athenians send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people were put into a place with many confusing paths, and a monster called the Minotaur ate them. But one of the young people, whose name was Theseus, fought the Minotaur and killed it. Suzanne thinks that Katniss Everdeen is like Theseus, but from the future.
